account.Federal Reserve Account: The checking account of the U.S. government. It is the main account through which the Treasury pays all the bills of the federal government.
account.Financial Institution Account: This was an account Treasury created to bail out Wall Street. The account was only used during FY 2009 and FY 2010.
account.Short Term Cash Investments ( Table V ): Please see Tax and Loan Note Accounts.
account.Supplementary Financing Program: The Supplementary Financing Program was another bailout-era initiative the Treasury used to pump money into the financial system in 2008. Read more about it here: http://www.treasury.gov/press-center/press-releases/Pages/hp1144.aspx
account.Tax and Loan Note Accounts ( Table V ): Treasury used these accounts to invest its excess cash until November 2008, when it suspended and later decommissioned the program. In October 2012, it renamed the program "Short Term Cash Investments." The accounts are no longer in use.
account.Total Operating Balance: This is the total cash the Treasury has on hand each day across all the accounts listed in the Daily Treasury Statement.
